    • Method Detail

      • fromColumn

        public static SplitColumn fromColumn(Column column,
                                     double splitValue)
        Create a split column from the given continuous column. The resulting column will have two classes, one for values strictly lower than splitThreshold and the second for the rest.
        Parameters:
        column - source column; isDiscrete() must return false
        splitValue - threshold value to split the column around
        Returns:
        discretized column
        See Also:
        ThresholdSplit

      • canSetContinuity

        public boolean canSetContinuity()
        Description copied from interface: Column
        Check if the continuity of this column is ambiguous or not.

        For example, a column with real-numbered values can not be treated as discrete, while a column with non-numerical string values (e.g. male/female) can never be treated as a continuous, numerical variable.

        Meanwhile, a column with just integer values could be interpreted both as a continuous (e.g. age in integral years) and as a discrete (e.g. a 0/1 boolean column) variable.

        Returns:
        true if the column can be interpreted both as discrete and as continuous

      • setContinuity

        public void setContinuity(Column.Continuity continuity)
        Description copied from interface: Column
        Set the continuity nature of this column, as returned by Column.isDiscrete().

        This method MUST NOT be called if Column.canSetContinuity() returns false.

        Specified by:
        setContinuity in interface Column
        Parameters:
        continuity - the new countinuity treatment to be applied

      • asClasses

        public final int[] asClasses()
        Description copied from interface: Column
        Get the class/partition of each value in the column. The return value is an array of integers in the range [0,N), where N is Column.classCount(), the total number of classes the column values can be in. Can only be used if Column.isDiscrete() returns true.
        Specified by:
        asClasses in interface Column
        Returns:
        row classes
        See Also:
        Column.classCount()

      • classCount

        public final int classCount()
        Description copied from interface: Column
        Get the number of distnict classes this column's values are divided into. It is guaranteed that the array returned by Column.asClasses() contains **at most** this many distinct values, and that every value in said array is strictly smaller than this value.

        Can only be used if Column.isDiscrete() returns true.

        Specified by:
        classCount in interface Column
        Returns:
        row classes
        See Also:
        Column.asClasses()

      • classLabel

        public java.lang.String classLabel(int classId)
        Description copied from interface: Column
        Return the label for the given class of a discrete column. Can only be used if Column.isDiscrete() returns true.
        Specified by:
        classLabel in interface Column
        Parameters:
        classId - the class ID in [0...N)
        Returns:
        class name/label
        See Also:
